concise_definition: v. 投降, 屈服, 交出

definitions.explanation_en: To give up resistance or control to an opponent, especially in a military or competitive context, often due to overwhelming force or the recognition of defeat.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在军事或竞争情境中，因力量悬殊或承认失败而放弃抵抗或控制权，向对手屈服。
definitions.example_en: After a long siege, the army surrendered to avoid further bloodshed.
definitions.example_cn: 经过长期围困后，军队投降以避免更多流血。

definitions.explanation_en: To yield or give up something valuable, such as rights, possessions, or control, often reluctantly or under pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在压力或被迫情况下，不情愿地交出有价值的东西，如权利、财产或控制权。
definitions.example_en: She surrendered her passport to the authorities during the investigation.
definitions.example_cn: 在调查期间，她将护照交给了当局。

definitions.explanation_en: To give in to an emotion, desire, or influence, often implying a loss of self-control or resistance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指屈服于某种情绪、欲望或影响，常暗示失去自我控制或抵抗能力。
definitions.example_en: He surrendered to his grief and cried for hours.
definitions.example_cn: 他任由悲伤支配，哭了好几个小时。

comparison.analysis: “Yield” (让步/屈服) 通常指在压力下暂时或部分地让出权利、空间或立场，语气较温和，不一定意味着彻底失败。而 “surrendered” 更强调彻底放弃抵抗，常带有失败或认输的意味。
“Capitulate” (投降) 与 “surrendered” 意义高度接近，多用于正式或军事语境，但 “capitulate” 更强调在明确条件下的投降，常带有“被迫接受条款”的含义，语气更书面化。而 “surrendered” 更通用，可用于情感、物理或抽象层面的放弃。
“Give in” (让步) 是口语化表达，多用于个人层面的妥协，如情绪、要求或习惯，通常不涉及权力或武力对抗。而 “surrendered” 更正式、更强烈，常涉及权力关系、对抗性情境，且后果更严重。
